newsitem.title: USA: Cintech to post Q3 charge of $0.07/shr.
newsitem.headline: Cintech to post Q3 charge of $0.07/shr.

text.p: Cintech Tele-Management Systems Inc said Monday that it expected to record a one-time inventory adjustment for the third quarter due to slower than expected sales of a product line.
The company said it would take a charge of $851,000 or $0.07 per share due to the cost of the remaining excess inventory of its OCTuS PTA line in the form of computer telephony hardware.
"This non-cash event is isolated to the OCTuS PTA product line, and in no way impacts the company's core Automatic Call Distribution (ACD) software operations," it said.

"Based upon preliminary sales data for the third quarter, the company anticipates reporting a 25-30 percent increase in ACD software revenues on a 40-45 percent increase in ACD software unit volumes compared to the third quarter last year," it said.
Cintech, based in Cincinnati, makes automatic call distribution and call information software for small offices.
